intro: Oenothera cockerellii, commonly known as the Cockerell's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves are typical of the genus Oenothera. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds.
